topic.title: What's new in 3.0
topic.shortdesc: Couchbase Server 3.0 is a major release that provides significant enhancements to performance, availability and reliability, ease of administration, and security.

body.p: Couchbase Server is a NoSQL document database for interactive web applications. It has a flexible data model, is easily scalable, provides consistent high performance and is “always-on,” meaning it can serve application data 24 hours, 7 days a week.
The new major feature in this release include:

ul.li:
Performance
Tunable memory (option to remove keys and metadata from memory).
Bucket disk I/O ejections (for faster persistence to disk).
Faster warm up from disk when restarting the server.

Availability and reliability
Faster XDCR without persisting to disk on the source cluster.
Index building without persisting to disk on the source cluster.

Ease of administration
Incremental backup
Incremental restore

Security
Data and password encryption between client and server
Secure administrator access
